page.title: 11A Tale of Two Pubs
page.content: In Halfway House there are two pubs next door to each other joined in one building. This is unusual.The 2 pubs are called 'The Seven Stars'and 'The Halfway House Inn'.There is a lot of difference between the 2 pubs.We live in the 'H.H.Inn' which is bigger.It has been said that the building (which is 200 years old) was one big one, but the family who owned it had a row.Some of the family put a brick wall between the two.We have a fairly good trade but the other pub's trade is light. The 'Seven Stars' has a lot of O.A.Ps. The 'H.H.Inn' has a more varied clientele. Recently due to road alterations the pub is no longer situated right on the A458. The landlord has therefore arranged chairs and tables outside the front. Unlike the 'H.H.Inn' the 'Seven Stars' does not cook food or have music.
